text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 1.2.63, Servicewide Policies and Authorities, Division Delegations of Authority for Large Business and International.
IRM 1.2.63.1, Introduction to Division Delegations of Authority for LB&I, has been updated to remove content that was appropriate for the June 3, 2021 (ﬁrst) issuance of this IRM.
) This IRM includes a revision to Division Delegation Order

, Authority to Engage in Outside Employment, Business and Other Activities. This delegation order was rescinded because the related Servicewide delegation order no longer permits redelegation. The LB&I Commissioner approved the rescission on July

This IRM includes a revision to Division Delegation Order 6-4-1, Authority to Engage in Outside Employment, Business and Other Activities. This delegation order was rescinded because the related Servicewide delegation order no longer permits redelegation. The LB&I Commissioner approved the rescission on July 13, 2021.

Division Delegations of Authority for Large Business and International 1.2.63
) Introduction to Division Delegations of Authority LB&I (

) This IRM contains delegation orders (DO) for the Large Business and Interna- tional (LB&I) Division. Distribution of this IRM should include all persons with need for any of the authorities or information in this section. All approved LB&I division delegation orders are listed in numerical order. (
) Each LB&I delegation order is based on a Servicewide delegation order. Ser- vicewide delegations of authority and can be found in IRM

, Servicewide Delegations of Authority. A Portable Document Format (PDF) version of this IRM can be obtained through the Electronic Publishing web site at http:// publish.no.irs.gov . Additional information on the delegation order process can be found in IRM
, Servicewide Delegation Order Process. (
) The format and numbering are consistent with guidance from Servicewide Policy, Directives and Electronic Resources (SPDER). For example, delegation order LB&I
shows: • LB&I: the organization issuing the redelegation order •
: the related Servicewide delegation order •
: the sequential number to indicate that more than one redelegation can be issued for each Servicewide delegation order.
) Principles (

) Division delegation orders should be issued only at the operating division (headquarters) level. Questions about current delegation orders, including revisions or issuance of new division delegation orders, should be directed to the LB&I Internal Management Document (IMD) coordinator at *LB&I IMD Coordinator . (

) Authority should be delegated directly to the lowest level expected to take ﬁnal action. Delegating authority to the lowest level for action means that every in- tervening supervisory position above the lowest level, including the Commissioner, has the same authority .
) LB&I Division Delegations of Authority (

) Current LB&I division delegation orders are listed in numerical sequence. New or revised LB&I division delegation orders approved after this IRM revision be found at https://www.irs.gov/privacy-disclosure/recently-approved-division- function-delegation-orders ; all documents are maintained on the website until the next IRM revision.
) Order LB&I (formerly DO (
) Training and Training Needs for Officials of Foreign Governments (
) Authority: To admit officials of foreign governments to training courses conducted by IRS and to authorize that they be supplied with texts and other training aids. (
) Delegated to: Director of Resource Solutions, Programs and Business International
page

Each LB&I delegation order is based on a Servicewide delegation order. Ser- vicewide delegations of authority and can be found in IRM 1.2.2, Servicewide Delegations of Authority. A Portable Document Format (PDF) version of this IRM can be obtained through the Electronic Publishing web site at http:// publish.no.irs.gov . Additional information on the delegation order process can be found in IRM 1.11.4, Servicewide Delegation Order Process.

1.2 Servicewide Policies and Authorities
Order LB&I LMSB (
) Pocket Commissions (

) Authority: To approve issuance of Pocket Commissions to those employees under their jurisdiction who are authorized to possess them. Pocket Commis- sions will be issued to those employees who are required to present proof of their authority in the performance of their official duties. Pocket Commissions are primarily intended to identify Service personnel to the public when dealing with tax matters. (
) Delegated to: • Assistant Deputy Commissioner Compliance Integration • Director, Program and Business Solutions • All Practice Area Directors and Directors, Field Operations (
) Redelegation: This authority may not be redelegated. (
) Source of Authority: IRM
, Civil Enforcement and Non-Enforcement Pocket Commissions; Servicewide Delegation Order
) To the extent that authority previously exercised consistent with this order require ratiﬁcation, it is hereby affirmed and ratiﬁed. This order supersedes Delegation Order LMSB
, effective May
) Signed: Nikole C. Flax, Commissioner, Large Business and International Division Order LB&I LMSB (
) Priority Consideration (
) Authority: To redelegate to certain executive levels the authority to authorize priority consideration as an appropriate remedy for a merit promotion violation. IRM

, Priority Consideration, requires priority consideration to be ordered by the Division Commissioner or the equivalent. The Division Commis- sioner or the equivalent may redelegate the approval authority for priority consideration to any executive or senior manager who is a direct report to Division Commissioner or who is a direct report to an executive. (
) Delegated to: • Assistant Deputy Commissioner Compliance Integration • Director, Program and Business Solutions • All Practice Area Directors and Directors, Field Operations (
) Redelegation: This authority may not be redelegated. (
) Sources of Authority: IRM
; Servicewide Delegation Order

Authority: To redelegate to certain executive levels the authority to authorize priority consideration as an appropriate remedy for a merit promotion violation. IRM 6.335.1.12.8, Priority Consideration, requires priority consideration to be ordered by the Division Commissioner or the equivalent. The Division Commis- sioner or the equivalent may redelegate the approval authority for priority consideration to any executive or senior manager who is a direct report to the Division Commissioner or who is a direct report to an executive.
LB&I (
) Authority to Grant and Withhold Exemption from Withholding on Nonresi- dent Aliens and Issue Final Exemption Payment Letter (
) Authority: To execute with an alien individual and a withholding agent on behalf of the Internal Revenue Service a Central Withholding Agreement for gross income equal to or greater than $
million. (
) Delegated to: Program Manager, Central Withholding Agreement Program, Withholding, Exchange, and Individual International Compliance (WEIIC), Large Business and International (LB&I) (
) Authority: To execute with an alien individual and a withholding agent on behalf of the Internal Revenue Service a Central Withholding Agreement for gross income less than $
million. (
) Delegated to: Team Manager, Central Withholding Agreement Program, holding, Exchange, and Individual International Compliance (WEIIC), Large Business and International (LB&I) (

) Authority: To issue on behalf of the Internal Revenue Service a letter to the withholding agent stating the amount of the ﬁnal payment of compensation personal services that is exempt from withholding. (
) Delegated to: Team Manager, Central Withholding Agreement Program, holding, Exchange, and Individual International Compliance (WEIIC), Large Business and International (LB&I) (
) Redelegation: This authority may not be redelegated. (
) Sources of Authority: Servicewide Delegation Order

) Closing Agreements Concerning Internal Revenue Tax Liability Note: This delegation order is being published as it was originally written in
The position titles and content of this delegation order are under review. (
) Authority: Commissioner’s Delegation Order
(formerly DO-
(Rev.

) Authorization: a. To enter into and approve a written agreement with any person relating the Internal Revenue tax liability of such person (or the person or estate for whom he/she acts) for a taxable period or periods ended prior to the date of agreement and related speciﬁc items affecting other taxable periods. This does not include the authority to set aside any closing agreement. b. To enter into and approve a written agreement with any person relating the Internal Revenue tax liability of such person (or of the person or estate for whom he/she acts) with respect to the performance of his or her functions as the Competent Authority under the tax conventions of the United States. This does not include the authority to set aside any closing agreement. c. In cases under the jurisdiction of Director, International, to enter into and approve written agreement with any person relating to the Internal Revenue tax liability of such person (or of the person or estate for whom he/she acts) and to provide for the mitigation of economic double taxation under section
of Revenue Procedure
C.B.
, under Revenue Procedure
C.B.
, and under Revenue Procedure
C.B.
, and to enter into and approve a written agreement providing the treatment available under Revenue Procedure
C.B.
This does not include the authority set aside any closing agreement. (
